This Privacy Policy applies to the CardiaCare Application (hereinafter referred to as the "App" or “CardiaCare”) owned by the STEMI India Charitable Trust (“STEMI India”), a not-for-profit organisation having its registered office situated at #204-205, Poongothai Nagar, Civil Aerodrome, Coimbatore – 641014. STEMI India recognizes the importance of maintaining your privacy. We value your privacy and appreciate your trust in us. This Policy describes how we treat user information we collect on CardiaCare. This Privacy Policy applies to all users of CardiaCare. By using and/or entering data into our App, you agree to this Privacy Policy.
What information do we collect?

Contact information:
We may collect details such as your Name, Email ID, Phone Number and Address.
Payment and billing information:
We do not collect your billing name, billing address and payment method. We NEVER collect your credit card number or credit card expiry date or other details pertaining to your credit card on our App.
 Demographic information:
We may collect demographic information about you, or any other information provided by your during the use of our App. We might collect this as part of a survey as well.
 Medical information:
We may collect information regarding your health profile such as whether you have diabetes, dyslipidemia or heart disease.
 Information about your lifestyle:
We may collect information about your lifestyle such as when and how much you exercise, how stressed you feel and when you smoke.
 Other information:
We may collect information about your IP address and the browser you're using. We might look at what site you came from, duration of time spent on our website, pages accessed or what site you visit when you leave us. We might also collect the type of mobile device you are using, or the version of the operating system your computer or device is running.
How do we collect information?

Direct collection:\nWe collect information directly from you when you enter details on your App or when you grant permission to upload your details to a STEMI Hospital. We also collect information if you post a comment on our websites or ask us a question through phone or email.
How do we use your personal information?

To contact you:
 • We share information you agree explicitly to share with the STEMI Hospitals in case of an emergency and you would like to reduce time to diagnose and treat a heart attack.
 • We might use the information you provide to contact you for follow up on treatment you received.
 • We might use your information to remind you of follow-up medication or check-ups.
 To improve our services:
 • We use information to improve our services. We might use your information to customize your experience with us. This could include displaying content based upon your preferences.
 • We use information to look at site trends and customer interests. We may use your information to make our App and services better.
 • We may combine information we get from you with information about you we get from third parties.
 To ensure security:
We use information for security purposes. We may use information to protect our company, our customers, or our websites. To abide by laws:
We use information as otherwise permitted by law.
Do we share information with third-parties?

• We will share information with third parties who perform services on our behalf.
 • We share information with vendors who help us manage our online registration process or transactional message processors. Some vendors may be located outside of India.
 • We may share information to comply with the law or to protect ourselves
 • We will share information to respond to a court order or subpoena. We may also share it if a government agency or investigatory body requests. Or, we might also share information when we are investigating potential fraud.
What about third-party sites?

If you click on one of the links to third-party websites, you may be taken to websites we do not control. This policy does not apply to the privacy practices of those websites. Read the privacy policy of other websites carefully. We are not responsible for these third-party sites.

STEMI India has been set up with the aim of bringing about universal access to heart-attack care in India. ST-Elevation Myocardial Infarction (STEMI) is the deadliest form of heart attack, the number one cause of death in India. It affects 3 million patients in India every year, of which only a very small fraction get access to any treatment at all.
 The STEMI India Model is the framework that has been recommended by the Indian Council of Medical Research as the National STEMI Protocol. It is a hub-and-spoke model that combines remote diagnosis with appropriate treatment protocols and also ensures BPL-insurance scheme benefits so that the poorest of the poor get access to top-of-the-line treatment.
Hospitals that implement this Model are in the STEMI Network. While using CardiaCare to upload your details into the STEMI Hospital device, you agree to share the details entered into the App with the STEMI Hospital. This will help save time in entering details during an emergency and will enable faster diagnosis – a crucial part of successful treatment of STEMI.
Your agreeing to share information is entirely voluntary.
By agreeing to these terms, you permit STEMI India, the doctor at the STEMI Hospital and his collecting staff to access the medical records and use it for diagnosis and deciding on appropriate treatment strategies. Research results may be published in medical literature, but the user will not be identified and all personal details such as names, phone numbers and email addresses will not be shared and will be completely secure.
